channel.title: Trade error Pi
channel.description: Hey can anyone help me im using Pi and when a fellow member sends me a request if i click on their request "Xzpozi wishes to trade with you" it comes p with Unable to find invalid name any idea?

item.title: Trade error Pi
item.dc:creator: @xXSh0ckXx xXSh0ckXx
item.description:
@xXSh0ckXx wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:10, topic:537508”][quote author=xXSh0ckXx link=topic=656329.msg4392312#msg4392312 date=1387961642]

The only issue I see in Trade.java is:

                if (c.inWild()) {
                        c.sendMessage("You can't trade in the wilderness!");
                }

doesn’t actually stop the person from trading.

Check client sided for packet 139 and tell me the code it has.

Quick fix:
Add a return;
[/quote]
Quick fix, I wanted him to do it himself. I figured he could by reading the other ones already in the file.[/quote]
Quick fix, this is a lesson which he will never forget.

Read full topic

doesn’t actually stop the person from trading.

item.title: Trade error Pi
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

o0x vvv x0o:

well if i knew what code to show i wouldnt be asking for help :3

No, if you knew how to fix the error you wouldn’t be asking for help. If you knew what code to post I’d assume you would have posted it. Because being able to see code and being able to read code are two different things…

http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/rs2-client/snippets/432193-pi-x-wishes-trade-you-follow-fix.html
Make sure your code looks like that, if the variables are named differently that is totally okay… Just make sure the frames are correct.

Also show me trade.java (Server sided, in the packets folder)

TradeAndDuel may help as well. but put that on http://pastebin.com and post the link here.

Read full topic
